Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Garth \Garth\ (g[aum]rth), n. [Icel. gar[eth]r yard. See {Yard}.] 1. A close; a yard; a croft; a garden; as, a cloister garth. [1913 Webster]
A clapper clapping in a garth To scare the fowl from fruit. --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]
2. A dam or weir for catching fish. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Garth \Garth\, n. [{Girth}.] A hoop or band. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
